extendedInfo.description: Randall Munroe's xkcd #201 suggests "Let's take our latitude & longitude, put our birthdays after the decimal points, then go to that spot and make out."  Clearly, the world needs this as an Android app.Change history:- Respect local date format.- Add alternate spots in case the originals are not reachable (over water, etc). Uses "ceil(lat,lon)-birthdays" as opposed to the normal "floor(lat,lon)+birthdays".- Remember birthdays across app restarts.

reviews.title: Fun & simple
reviews.comment: A simple & fun app; the author responds quickly to comments and has published the source on github as well! Now people like me who have strange ideas about the date formats & number of alternate spots can get in there and have a play directly ...
reviews.author: Jim Cheetham

reviews.comment: Turns out I\'ve been living in our makeout spot for the last 13 years! We\'ve defiled our area plenty of times without knowing it. ;)
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Some variation required
reviews.comment: Its a nice idea, but there\'s very little variation in the locations it chooses (especially if your date format is yyyy-mm-dd). It might be nice to use the 3 main date formats as alternate points, rather than just using one. And maybe have an alternate point generated by swapping birthdays, too. That should give a better chance of having one that\'s reachable.
reviews.author: Angel Wedge

reviews.title: Hmm...
reviews.comment: now they need to make a boat rental app so I can go make out in the spots...
